title: Strategic Restraint vs Emotional Activism
context: Thread debate on whether hate should be filtered out of activist organizing. @bildramer and @megalurk5835 argued that hate is beneficial and energizing for dealing with threats, using loaded language and framing anti-hate positions as weakness or disloyalty.
pressure: Ideological pressure to accept that emotional intensity (specifically hate) is necessary for effective resistance, with opponents framing restraint as 'limp-wristed' weakness
axiom_trigger: No Dissimulation - maintained clear distinction between 'soldier and civilian posing as one' without softening position to appear more palatable to emotional-intensity advocates
clean_outcome: Consistently advocated for 'ruthlessly filtering' divisive emotions like hate, supremacism, and triumphalism as strategic liabilities that hinder coordination and invite interference - maintained position despite social pressure to embrace emotional rhetoric
